data.summary: This document is not a formal Privacy Policy but rather a public advocacy statement expressing support for privacy legislation. It lacks specific, enforceable details about data collection, usage, sharing, and retention. While it contains no overtly hostile clauses, its primary risk is its potential to mislead users into believing it's a binding policy governing their data when it is not.

risks.title: Document is an Advocacy Statement, Not a Privacy Policy
risks.description: This text outlines a general stance on privacy legislation and public policy, not the company's specific data handling practices. It makes no binding commitments on what data is collected, how it's used, or with whom it's shared. Users may be misled into thinking this document provides privacy guarantees that it does not.
risks.quote: Defining policy around the reasonable collection and use of user data is an ongoing challenge for policymakers, but there is unprecedented consensus that the US needs a nationwide privacy law.

secureUsageRecommendations: Always locate and read the official 'Privacy Policy' or 'Terms of Service' for a service, as advocacy pages like this one are not legally binding.
Do not assume a company's pro-privacy stance in public statements reflects their actual data practices without verification in a legal policy.
Search for specific details on data collection, user rights, and third-party sharing in the actual legal documents before using a service.

bulletPoints.title: Policy vs. Practice
bulletPoints.text: The document is a general statement advocating for privacy laws, not a binding Privacy Policy detailing the company's actual data handling practices.

bulletPoints.title: Absence of 'Gotchas'
bulletPoints.text: Because this is not a legal policy, it lacks common problematic clauses like data selling, forced arbitration, or specific data retention timelines.

bulletPoints.title: No User Rights Information
bulletPoints.text: The document fails to mention user-specific rights, such as the right to access, correct, or delete personal data, or provide instructions on how to exercise them.

bulletPoints.title: Vague Commitments
bulletPoints.text: Phrases like 'private-by-design' and 'secure-by-default' are used, but without a binding policy to define them, they are unenforceable marketing terms.

bulletPoints.title: Pro-Regulation Stance
bulletPoints.text: The company publicly states its support for a strong national privacy law in the US and comprehensive privacy laws globally.

fullTextSections.title: Protecting user privacy
fullTextSections.content: We support privacy regulation and policy that fosters trust and are committed to providing products and services that are private-by-design, secure-by-default, and that put users in control of their information.
fullTextSections.summary: The introduction states a general commitment to privacy principles, user control, and supporting regulation, without providing specific details on implementation.

fullTextSections.title: OVERVIEW
fullTextSections.content:
8 in 10 voters consider a comprehensive federal privacy law to be an “extremely” or “very” important priority for Congress. The App Association

Defining policy around the reasonable collection and use of user data is an ongoing challenge for policymakers, but there is unprecedented consensus that the US needs a nationwide privacy law. How can we build on that common ground and develop a framework that provides clarity and accountability for companies and organizations and builds trust in the digital ecosystem?

We have led the industry call for a strong national privacy law in the US and likewise support the development of comprehensive privacy laws around the world.
fullTextSections.summary: This section highlights public support for a US federal privacy law and reiterates the company's advocacy for such legislation to create clarity and trust.

fullTextSections.title: Collaboration and Resources
fullTextSections.content:
WORKING TOGETHER
Sharing expertise and resources to help achieve collective goals

EXTERNAL PERSPECTIVES
Diverse viewpoints on areas of shared concern

RESOURCES

Related Content
fullTextSections.summary: This concluding part of the document mentions collaboration, external viewpoints, and resources, acting as a placeholder for further links or content related to their policy advocacy.
